tasks.task: Reading pesticide labels and safety measures
subtasks: Determine the pest to control
Select appropriate chemical for control
Choose the correct pesticide formulation
Understand the product's brand name and formulation type
Identify active and non-active ingredients
Assess the pesticide's toxicity level
Locate first aid and physician information on the label
Follow instructions for applying the pesticide
Wear protective clothing and gloves
Cover sleeves and protect wrists
Use long pants, coveralls, and appropriate footwear
Wear goggles or face shield
Change clothes immediately after use
Clean protective gear after each use
Store pesticides safely in original labeled containers
Transport pesticides in a secured plastic tub
Select a cool, dry storage location away from water
Properly handle pesticide spills and disposal
Recognize symptoms of pesticide poisoning
Call paramedics if severe poisoning occurs
Use low pressure spray to avoid drift
Avoid applying in moderate or strong winds
Keep unauthorized people and children away
Monitor wind direction when operating equipment
Store pesticides out of reach of non-target animals
Prevent pesticide runoff into water sources
Dispose of containers properly by destroying or burying
Prevent leakage by securely storing containers

Reading pesticide labels and safety measures. Under that, the subtasks would involve determining the pest to control (SUBTASK), selecting the right chemical (SUBTASK), choosing the correct formulation (SUBTASK). Then on the label, there's information like brand name, active and non-active ingredients, toxicity levels, first aid, etc. So those would be individual subtasks like identifying brand name (SUBTASK), understanding active ingredients (SUBTASK), noting toxicity (SUBTASK), and so on.

Applying pesticides safely. This includes wearing protective clothing (full coverage, gloves, goggles), changing clothes afterward, cleaning gear, etc. Subtasks here would be putting on protective gear (SUBTASK: cover sleeves, wear long pants, etc.), changing clothes immediately (SUBTASK), cleaning protective equipment daily (SUBTASK).

Environmental precautions. This would cover storing pesticides safely (cool, dry place, away from water), transporting them properly (secured container), disposing of them correctly (no leakage, destroy containers), and preventing runoff and drift. Each of these forms a subtask like storing out of reach (SUBTASK), preventing water contamination (SUBTASK), proper disposal (SUBTASK: destroy or bury containers).

tasks.task: Responding to pesticide poisoning. Subtasks here would be knowing symptoms (mild to severe) and what actions to take (calling paramedics if severe, first aid from label instructions).
Application safety, with subtasks like avoiding wind direction, keeping others away, and monitoring drift.
